item.title: Past Research
item.description: Past Research Pattern Formation In the Min System Symmetry breaking and pattern formation are critical to the existence of complex life in the world around us, and have fascinated researchers for many years. A particularly beautiful example of this is the Min system for cell division, in which the regulatory proteins MinD and MinE ensure cell division down the midline of the cell through a ``chase and release” mechanism that inhibits cell division near either cell pole (depicted right).

item.title: Teaching
item.description: For Students I am not currently teaching. Previously I have taught: Multivariate Calculus at University of British Columbia Derivative Calculus for Life Scientist at University of British Columbia Derivative Calculus for Physical Sciences and Engineering at University of British Columbia STAR course (University mathematics for highschool students) at University of Canterbury (NZ)
